content.question:
A researcher is studying three transport proteins (A, B, and C) in the membrane and has observed that protein A exhibits passive transport. Figure 1 shows the movement of solute particles in the different transport proteins. In the figure, two different conformations of the same protein are shown for protein B and protein C.

Figure 1. Transport proteins A, B, and C in the membrane

Based on Figure 1, which of the following experiments would best confirm that protein A utilizes passive transport, while proteins B and C do not?

choices.label: Measuring the rate of solute transport through each protein at various temperatures.
Comparing the ATP consumption of cells expressing each protein type during solute transport.
Analyzing the amino acid sequences of all three proteins to identify structural similarities.
Determining the direction and rate of solute movement through each protein.

content.answer: Comparing the ATP consumption of cells expressing each protein type during solute transport.

skill.text: 3.D: Propose a new investigation based on an evaluation of the experimental design or evidence.
